item.title: SSS#10
item.description: Good evening. I’m a day late with the update. To be honest, there is nothing much to post. I’m starting to feel that it would be reckless to update every week, so I think I’ll go back to updating irregularly from now on. I was down with a cold, but I’m better now and my motivation has picked up a lot in the past two days. I will be back to developing again in good spirits.

item.title: SSS#9
item.description: Hey guys. No images or videos this week. My original plan was to upload a few progress images each week at……. Is this due to my laziness or just lack of talent? That’s the mood I’m in. I had a dinner with my wife’s family the other day, and I couldn’t smile at all, I was downcast the whole time. It was my own inadequacy. Simply put, I’m not doing very well.

item.title: SSS#8.5 - Why I quit pixel art
item.description: (This article is not about game dev. It is an edited version of a personal letter.) TO: **** I am still a little concerned about my refusal to accept your invitation. I feel like I was being a little mean when I made the statement that “I don’t trust your boss.” The truth is that I have completely lost all desire to create a background in pixel art. I spent my late teens and early twenties studying to become an animation background artist.

item.title: SSS#8
item.description: Hey guys. No videos or pics this week. I put a sprite of the character on the background of the sneak peek I wrote last week and moved it around. I was very happy with the result, but I can’t publish it on the internet because of copyright issues with the sprite I used as a placeholder. In any case, I can report that I have made some progress in the initial stages of graphic development.

item.title: SSS#7 - Prepare for next journey_01
item.description: I have decided to update this devlog every Monday from now on. As you know, my progress is very slow, so I don’t think I’ll be able to write much, but I thought it’s important to update even the most trivial things. There is something I forgot to upload in my last post. A video of a camera test with defold-orthographic. I am considering using it in the future because it is easy to control the zoom from the script, although some adjustments are necessary.

item.title: SSS#6 - City and Nature
item.description: Hey everyone. I’d like to report on the progress I’ve made over the past week or so. I am still sketching over and over. At first I had in mind the story of a man living in a city. Something like this(or please read previous post). However, I gradually realized that as a painter I did not enjoy painting cities. (lol, example of trying to emphasize a distinctive style and losing myself.

item.title: SSS#4 - Finally I made a piece of shit and the development log of it.
item.description: Hey guys. I finally published a small game the past few days. The Hollo Men on itch.io As those of you who have played it will know (if you haven’t, you don’t need to play it, it’s a waste of time), this is an undeniably shitty game. I spent about a month on it, and I produced crap. But I don’t regret it too much, because the requirements I set when I started this project had been met.

item.title: SSS#3 - Ludum Dare 48: My first challenge to a game jam.
item.description: On April 24 - 27, 2021, Ludum Dare 48 - An event to create a game in 72 hours - was held. I was invited by my friend Thomas Olsson to participate in my first game jam as an pixel artist. I would like to share my overall impressions. I think it would be helpful for artists who are interested in game jam but have never participated in it before.

item.title: SSS #2 - Considering about genre, and some sketches
item.description: Hey guys. This is my second update. I really wanted to do a weekly update, but I couldn’t do it last week. It seemed to me that there was nothing worth showing to everyone. A friend said to me, “You should update your development blog every week. And see if it’s better to look good or to be forgotten by everyone. Maybe it’s worth it to write that development isn’t going well.

item.title: SSS #1 - Introduce
item.description: Hello everyone, Thank you for your interest in my work and for coming here. On March 2, 2021, I posted a pixel art on twitter. WIP #gamedev #Indiegamedev pic.twitter.com/BcddyRq7Xr — SLOTET (@SlotetStudios) March 2, 2021 This is the concept art for my game, which I drew little by little in between contract jobs. As many of you may know, this pixel art was seen by quite a few people. This is the first time in my life that I’ve done this, so I was very surprised, and more than anything, I was happy to see the warm response from you guys.
